p: In order to select specific oils and surfactants that would exhibit the optimum dispersed particle size, various vehicle compositions without the drug were prepared and evaluated. As shown in Table 1, oils and surfactants were weighed at various weight ratios (1/3, 2/2, or 3/1), heated to 60 °C, and stored at 4 °C for 24 h for possible solidification. The samples were taken out and equilibrated at room temperature. Then, 100 mg of the sample was taken, and 1 mL of water at 37 °C was added. This was followed by vortexing for 1 min to completely disperse the samples. The particle size of the samples was measured by particle size analyzer, and the melting point of each vehicle composition was measured by DSC.
